The BALSAC dataset is used for annotating and evaluating text line segmentation in historical documents. It involves creating simple polygon annotations, including line ascenders and descenders, to assess the accuracy of segmentation systems. The dataset is crucial for evaluating the performance of these systems, particularly in handling well-spaced text lines. Studies have also used BALSAC to evaluate the impact of normalized ground-truth on pixel-level performance, noting improvements in Intersection over Union (IoU) scores. However, unification did not enhance results due to thin original annotations, affecting the performance of Handwritten Text Recognition (HTR) systems.; The Balsac dataset is used to evaluate and improve text line segmentation in historical documents, focusing on pixel-level performance and the impact of normalized ground-truth data on IoU scores. It is also used to annotate images with polygons, including line ascenders and descenders, and to assess the quality of these annotations for historical text recognition (HTR) systems. The dataset helps evaluate the spacing of text line polygons and trains handwritten document recognition systems, particularly for population records.
